item.title: Paul add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Paul add a quote by Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
item.description: "A man's mind is stretched by a new idea or sensation, and never shrinks back to its former dimensions." -- Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

item.title: Paul add a quote by Jack London
item.description: "He was mastered by the sheer surging of life, the tidal wave of being, the perfect joy of each separate muscle, joint, and sinew in that it was everything that was not death, that it was aglow and rampant, expressing itself in movement, flying exultantly under the stars." -- Jack London

item.title: Paul add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "A book lying idle on a shelf is wasted ammunition." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Paul add a quote by Katherine Applegate
item.description: "I always tell the truth, Stella replies. Although I sometimes confuse the facts." -- Katherine Applegate

item.title: Paul add a quote by Walker Evans
item.description: "Stare, pry, listen, eavesdrop. Die knowing something. You are not here long." -- Walker Evans

item.title: Paul add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov
